instruction: What kinds of spectra were used in the related study on determining the contents of antihistamine decongestants?

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were employed in the artificial neural networks and least squares support vector machines used in the related research?

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the different methods, and how far can this metric go in selecting the best model for determining antihistamine decongestant contents?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the different methods was the mean square error (MSE), regression coefficient (R2), correlation coefficient (r), mean recovery (%), and relative standard deviation (RSD). These statistical parameters were used to assess the accuracy and precision of the models in predicting the antihistamine decongestant contents. 

The metric can go a long way in selecting the best model for determining antihistamine decongestant contents. By comparing the values of MSE, R2, r, mean recovery (%), and RSD for each method, it is possible to identify the model that provides the most accurate and precise predictions. Additionally, the comparison of these metrics with the reference method, high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC), further validates the performance of the proposed methods. The absence of significant differences between the suggested methods and the reference method, as determined by the one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) test, indicates that the chosen metrics are effective in selecting the best model.

instruction: How do the performance and accuracy of the artificial neural networks (ANNs) and least squares support vector machines (LS-SVM) compare to the traditional method (HPLC) in determining the contents of antihistamine decongestants based on absorption spectra?
Output:
The performance and accuracy of the artificial neural networks (ANNs) and least squares support vector machines (LS-SVM) were compared to the traditional method of high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) in determining the contents of antihistamine decongestants based on absorption spectra. The study found that the proposed intelligent methods, ANNs and LS-SVM, showed promising results in predicting the antihistamine decongestant contents. 

In the first step, the feed-forward back-propagation network with two different training algorithms, Levenberg-Marquardt (LM) and gradient descent with momentum and adaptive learning rate back-propagation (GDX), were employed. The performance of the LM algorithm was found to be better than the GDX algorithm.

In the second step, the radial basis network was utilized and its results were compared with the previous network. 

Lastly, the LS-SVM method was proposed as another intelligent method to construct the antihistamine decongestant prediction model. The results of the LS-SVM method were compared with the two aforementioned networks.
